title: Agent Memory Systems Patterns
description: Comprehensive patterns for implementing multi-tier memory systems in AI agents including Short-term, Long-term (Episodic, Semantic, Procedural), and Graph-based memory.

short_term_memory.name: Short-term / In-context Memory
short_term_memory.description: Transient memory held within the LLM context window or active session state.

mechanisms.description: Keeps the last N tokens or messages, discarding oldest when limit is reached.
mechanisms.best_for: Conversational continuity with strict token limits.

mechanisms.description: Periodically summarizes older conversation history to condense information while preserving context.
mechanisms.best_for: Long-running sessions where historical gist is more important than exact quotes.

mechanisms.description: Persisting the current agent state (LangGraph Checkpointer) to allow seamless thread resumption.

long_term_memory.name: Long-term / Persistent Memory
long_term_memory.description: Persistent storage of knowledge, experiences, and preferences across sessions.

episodic.name: Episodic Memory
episodic.description: Record of specific past events and interactions.
episodic.implementation: Vector database (Chroma, Pinecone) storing embedded chat logs with temporal metadata.

semantic.name: Semantic Memory
semantic.implementation: Knowledge Graph (Neo4j, Mem0) or structured JSON/YAML document stores.

procedural.name: Procedural Memory
procedural.description: Tool-use history, skill execution successful patterns, and 'how-to' knowledge.
procedural.implementation: Workflow logs and specialized skill registries.

working_memory.name: Working Memory / Scratchpad
working_memory.description: Immediate workspace for managing incremental states and sub-task coordination.
working_memory.implementation: Agent local variables, transient session cache, or 'Thought' artifacts.

graph_memory.name: Graph-based Associative Memory
graph_memory.description: Memory represented as nodes (entities) and edges (relationships) for multi-hop reasoning.

integration_guidelines: Use Vector RAG for semantic search of broad knowledge.
Use Knowledge Graphs for precise fact/relationship retrieval.
Combine STM and LTM using a Multi-tier Memory Controller.
Ensure memory pruning to prevent 'memory bloating' and irrelevant context injection.

example_architectures.name: Mem0 Hybrid
example_architectures.description: Combines vector similarity with graph-based entity relationships.

example_architectures.name: LangGraph Persistence
example_architectures.description: Uses Postgres checkpointers for STM and VectorDB for LTM.
